about.title: About Our School
about.subtitle: Discover the heart and soul of Maplekids - where every child's journey begins

highlight.description: Founded in 2024, Maplekids was started with a vision to nurture early life learnings in children, helping them grow into responsible, confident, and future-ready individuals. We believe every child is unique and gifted, and our mission is to preserve their natural qualities while guiding them through joyful, value-based, and holistic learning.

cta.description: Join hundreds of happy families who trust us with their little ones' early education. Give your child the best start in life with Maplekids Play School.

footer.tagline: Nurturing young minds with love, care, and quality education

social.title: Social Skills

mchatTest.title: M-CHAT Test
questions: Does your child enjoy being swung, bounced on your knee, etc.?
Does your child take an interest in other children?
Does your child like climbing on things, such as up stairs?
Does your child enjoy playing peek-a-boo/hide-and-seek?
Does your child ever pretend, for example, to talk on the phone or take care of a doll or pretend other things?
Does your child ever use his/her index finger to point, to ask for something?
Does your child ever use his/her index finger to point, to indicate interest in something?
Can your child play properly with small toys (e.g. cars or blocks) without just mouthing, fiddling, or dropping them?
Does your child ever bring objects over to you (parent) to show you something?
Does your child look you in the eye for more than a second or two?
Does your child ever seem oversensitive to noise? (e.g., plugging ears)
Does your child smile in response to your face or your smile?
Does your child imitate you? (e.g., you make a face-will your child imitate it?)
Does your child respond to his/her name when you call?
If you point at a toy across the room, does your child look at it?
Does your child walk?
Does your child look at things you are looking at?
Does your child make unusual finger movements near his/her face?
Does your child try to attract your attention to his/her own activity?
Have you ever wondered if your child is deaf?
Does your child understand what people say?
Does your child sometimes stare at nothing or wander with no purpose?
Does your child look at your face to check your reaction when faced with something unfamiliar?

importantNotice.title: ⚠️ Important Notice
importantNotice.text: This screening tool is not a diagnostic tool. It helps identify children who may need further evaluation. Always consult with healthcare professionals for proper assessment and diagnosis.

questions.question: Can your child pick up small objects (like beads or coins) using thumb and index finger?
Does your child use scissors to cut along a straight line?
Can your child tie shoelaces independently?
Does your child write letters and numbers with proper formation?
Can your child catch a large ball (8-10 inches) thrown from 3 feet away?
Does your child throw a ball overhand with some accuracy?
Can your child catch a tennis ball with one hand?
Does your child hit a target (like a basket or goal) from 10 feet away?
Can your child walk on a straight line (like a curb or tape on floor)?
Does your child hop on one foot for at least 3 hops?
Can your child walk backward heel-to-toe for 5 steps?
Does your child maintain balance while standing on one foot for 10 seconds?
Can your child button and unbutton clothes independently?
Does your child participate in team sports requiring hand-eye coordination?
Can your child ride a bicycle without training wheels?
Does your child follow simple one-step instructions (e.g., 'Get your shoes')?
Does your child use 2-3 word phrases to communicate needs?
Can others understand most of what your child says?
Does your child maintain eye contact during conversations?
Does your child understand 'who', 'what', 'where' questions?
Does your child use complete sentences (4+ words) to express ideas?
Does your child pronounce most sounds correctly for their age?
Does your child take turns in conversations appropriately?
Does your child understand complex instructions with multiple steps?
Does your child tell stories with a clear beginning, middle, and end?
Does your child initiate play with other children?
Does your child calm down within 10-15 minutes after being upset?
Does your child share toys or take turns during play?
Does your child engage in pretend or imaginative play?
Does your child show empathy when others are hurt or sad?
Does your child express emotions appropriately for the situation?
Does your child ask for help when needed?
Does your child follow rules in group games?
Does your child make and maintain friendships?
Does your child handle disappointment or frustration well?
